title: Astros Throw Second No-Hitter in World Series History
description: Cristian Javier and three relievers shut down the powerful Philadelphia Phillies, tying the World Series and accomplishing a feat that hadn’t happened since 1956.
dc:creator: Scott Miller
media:description: Houston’s Cristian Javier was dominant for six innings. He struck out nine, issued two walks and did not allow a hit. Three relievers finished off the first World Series no-hitter since Don Larsen’s perfect game for the Yankees in 1956.
